p: ROS and FR are general terms used to signify molecules and reactive intermediates that have a highly positive redox potential in living organismsâ€™ cells ( Vatansever et al., 2013). They can assault a number of targets for antimicrobial activity, which is responsible for their flexibility in host mediation against a large array of pathogens ( Winterbourn, 2008). EOs were found to produce ROS and FR during antimicrobial activities in their mode of action due to their structural components, which play a role in inducing oxidative stress and destroying the microbial cells ( Nazzaro et al., 2017).
